b.waggle
200m

The "waggle dance" is used by foraging honeybees to communicate the location of a food source to other bees in the hive.

Performed on a vertical wall, the angle relative to the top indicates the angle of the food source from the sun. The duration of the dance cycle indicates the distance.

This interactive demonstration is based on analysis of real data collected from honeybees. Thanks go to P.L. Kohl and B. Rutschmann for their work.
